Govt consults public on proposed amendments to advertising law
abstract: The Economic and Technological Development Bureau (DSEDT) is proposing various amendments to the current law regulating advertising, such as more clearly defining its various rules that advertisers must comply with and streamlining the government’s administrative procedures for permitting businesses to install advertisements on the external walls of buildings.The proposed streamlined administrative procedures include replacing the current licensing system with a registration system.The bureau July 7, 2025 | BY Tony Wong

title: 3rd locally bottled water exceeds bacterial standards: IAM
abstract: The Municipal Affairs Bureau (IAM) said in a statement on Friday afternoon that 18.9-litre potable water containers from another local manufacturer have been found to exceed official bacteria standards.It was the third case of its kind within a month.The first case was confirmed on June 20, affecting the local O’Sun brand.This second case concerned the local NK brand’s 18.9-litre potable bottled water containers which were confirmed on Tuesday to exceed official bacterial standards.The July 7, 2025 | BY Armindo Neves

title: Macau Book Carnival kicks off
abstract: The Macau Book Carnival kicked off on Friday at the Macao Polytechnic University’s (MPU) Multi-Sport Pavilion, with this year’s event marking the 28th edition and will be held through Sunday, inviting book lovers to visit.The event, organised by the Macao Association of Literacy Promotion and this year themed “East Asian Culture is the Brilliance of the World”, features thousands of titles, according to a statement on the carnival’s Facebook page. Carnival-goers can browse and buy July 7, 2025 | BY Rui Pastorin

title: Childcare allowance’s applications to start next Wednesday
abstract: The Social Welfare Bureau (IAS) has announced that the application period for the government’s newly launched childcare allowance will start on Wednesday next week.The bureau, the public entity implementing the childcare allowance programme, made the announcement in a statement on Friday.The new childcare allowance launched on a provisional basis will cover permanent local residents under the age of three born in or before 2027. Each beneficiary will receive an annual allowance of 18,000 July 7, 2025 | BY Tony Wong

MGM, MGTO organise 3rd seminar under joint training series Integrated resort operator MGM recently organised its third seminar with the Macau Government Tourism Office (MGTO) under their joint “Together We Deliver Exceptional Hospitality as Tourism Ambassadors” training series, this time themed“Be the Digital Ambassador: Showcasing Macao’s Charm with Online Courtesy”.Held at MGM COTAI, a statement from the company on Wednesday said that the seminar was attended by over 230 participants from MGM, the industry and local universities. Macao July 7, 2025 | BY Rui Pastorin

Melco presents ‘meet the musicians’ Melco Resorts & Entertainment presented the “Macao Orchestra Meet the Musicians” event late last month at Studio City in Cotai, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.Focusing on strings, the event featured Macao Orchestra Assistant Conductor Tony Cheng-Te Yeh, First Violin Wang Yue, Second Violin Cao Hui, Li Yueying on Viola, Yan Feng on Cello, and Principal Double Bass Tibor Tóth.Attendees featured students from

title: Cooperation, autonomy and win-win results defining features of healthy economic ties China Daily Editorial
abstract: The global trade landscape has been roiled by the United States’ trade policies and actions.Even though US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has said he expects a “flurry” of deals to materialize before the July 9 deadline, time is running out. Some US trading partners are still far from making a deal before US President Donald Trump’s 90-day pause comes to an end.The US administration started sending letters to various economies on Friday July 7, 2025 | BY admin

Iao Hon vendor stalls ‘optimisation’ project to start in Sept: IAM
abstract: The Municipal Affairs Bureau (IAM) will start its gradual optimisation project of the Iao Hon vendor stalls in September, but the vendors’ businesses will only “minimally be disrupted” by the revamp, Northern District Community Service Consultative Council deputy convener Chan Ian Ian said yesterday.Chan made the remarks during a press briefing after a regular closed-door meeting with IAM officials at the Government Service Centre in Areia Preta yesterday.A dozen vendor stalls in the area July 4, 2025 | BY Ida Cheong

title: Police nab Nepali showing porn video to 3 underage girls Public Service Police (PSP) spokeswoman Cheong Im Sim announced at a regular press conference yesterday that a male non-resident worker (NRW) from Nepal was detained for showing pornographic videos to three underage female students from the same secondary school.The press conference was held at the Judiciary Police (PJ) headquarters in Zape.Cheong identified the suspect as a 49-year-old Nepali surnamed Rana who told police that he works as a security guard.According to Cheong, on July 4, 2025 | BY Armindo Neves
